message.content:
cs.HC, cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.CY, cs.LG. 

The paper discusses the development of innovative techniques and tools for assistive technology, specifically focusing on making reading easier for individuals with physical and intellectual disabilities. This topic falls under the category of human-computer interaction (cs.HC), as well as natural language processing (cs.CL) and information retrieval (cs.IR) due to the text simplification aspect. Additionally, the use of handheld devices and eye tracking devices suggests a potential connection to cybernetics (cs.CY) and machine learning (cs.LG) in terms of the technology being used.
